Description: Adoration of the Magi, study for an engraving by Egidius Sadeler; the Virgin standing at right with the Christ Child, and five figures. Pen and brown ink, with grey-brown wash, heightened with white, indented for transfer Verso: Traces of black and red (chalk?)
Curator's comments: This was first attributed to Hans von Aachen by Gerszi, who reproduced the associated engraving by Egidius Sadeler (Hollstein Dutch xxi-xxii, no.35) for which it is a direct study. Sadeler's print has a wide ornamental border designed by Joris Hoefnagel; the companion print by Sadeler is a 'Rest on the Flight into Egypt' after Spranger (Hollstein 36). Prior to this, the drawing was placed with the anonymous sixteenth-century Dutch and Flemish drawings. Jacoby dates the drawing to about 1590. Lit: Teréz Gerszi, 'Bulletin du Musée Hongrois des Beaux-Arts', 73, 1990, pp.32ff; J. Jacoby, New Hollstein German, Rotterdam, 1996, p.16, fig.8, p.67, under no.20; J. Jacoby in 'Hans von Aachen 1552-1615: Court Artist in Europe, exhibition catalogue, Aachen, Prague and Vienna, 2010, no. 42
Bibliographic references: Popham (D & F) 1932 / Dutch and Flemish drawings of the XV and XVI centuries (8) (as 'Anonymous Unmounted Drawings')
Exhibition history: 1997 May-Sep, Prague Castle Picture Gallery, Rudolf II 2010 Mar-Jun, Aachen, Suermondt-Ludwig Museum, Hans von Aachen 2010 Jul-Oct, Prague Castle Picture Gallery, Hans von Aachen 2014 Feb-May, London, National Gallery, 'Strange Beauty'
